title: Simmons-Harris was a 2002 ruling by the U.S. Supreme Court (536 U.S. 639). It held that Cleveland's school voucher program (and others like it) did not violate the First Amendment's "establishment of religion

note: Conversion charter schools sponsored by traditional public school districts were allowed statewide.
title: House Bill 215-established a pilot charter (signed into law) school program in Lucas County. The measure Proposed in February 1997 allowed for creation of both start-up and conversion charter schools, with the former permitted only in the Lucas County pilot study area

Senate Bill 55-expanded the charter school (signed into law) program beyond Lucas County, added the State Proposed in March 1997 Board of Education as a sponsor, and provided for the creation of start-up charters within the Ohio Big 8 urban districts

Terry Ryan is vice president for Ohio programs and policy at the Thomas B. Fordham Foundation (http://www.edexcellence.net). In this position, Ryan leads all Ohio operations for the foundation and its sister organization, the Thomas B. Fordham Institute, which include charter school sponsorship, grant making, and state research and policy efforts

container-title: He is a Stanford University's Hoover Institution Research Fellow and a 2008 New Schools Venture Fund/Aspen Institute Fellow
note: From late 1995 to November
title: He has lived and worked in Dayton since 2003 and has been close to the charter school efforts in that city and in Columbus. Ryan has served on the boards of the Ohio Charter School Association, School Choice Ohio, and the Keys to Improving Dayton Schools (k.i.d.s.) organization
Ryan served as senior researcher for the United Kingdom-based 21st Century Learning Initiative
